title: Untitled

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All surveillance, body cam, dash cam, and rear camera footage related to the arrest of Kathleen Schuman. The incident took place on September 8 at approx. 5:45pm at the Belmont Villas Senior Apartments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniele Mazzei

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of Sept 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of Sept 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nikita Shalimov

title: Public Records Request – ALPR Hot Lists

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request – ALPR Hot Lists
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	A description of all “hot lists” or “custom hot lists” currently maintained for use in Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) systems.
	
2.	Any policies, agreements, or data-sharing documents identifying external data sources used to populate those lists (e.g., DMV data on suspended/revoked licenses, NCIC, CLETS, Amber Alerts, stolen vehicle databases).
	
3.	The criteria under which plates are added or removed from hot lists.

Please provide documents in electronic form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nikita Shalimov

title: UC Merced PRA Databases

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: UC Merced PRA Databases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1 — any databases and/or spreadsheets used to track requests under the California Public Records Act from January 1, 2024 to the date of this request's fulfillment.
2 — any and all policy documents, manuals, memos and/or reports regarding the processing of public records requests from January 1, 2024 to the date of this request's fulfillment.

In the regard to the database requested in paragraph 1, please provide the database in its original electronic format pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code § 6253.9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Vidalia IT and Social Media RFP, Bid, and Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The RFP that the City of Vidalia published which resulted in the recent contract it entered into with Parlor Marketing for web and social media services.
The location(s) where this RFP was published, including publication dates.

The contract that the City entered into with Parlor Marketing.

James Andrew Laurel

title: Lake Geneva Wisconsin Invoice for appraisal

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Lake Geneva Wisconsin Invoice for appraisal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please send a copy of the invoice for the appraisal provided to the Lake Geneva city council members on July 14,2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gary Milliette

Hello,

The City is in receipt of your open records request. Please be aware of the following if applicable:
•	The charge for copies of records is 25 cents per side of page.
•	The charge for any other media is at the actual cost.
•	Pursuant to 19.35(3)(f), Wis. Stats., if the amount to be imposed is more than $5.00, the authority may require prepayment. 
•	Pursuant to Section 19.35(3)(c), Wis. Stats., if the cost to locate the record will cost more than $50.00, the authority may require payment of the location costs. 
•	If a record request response is mailed, the authority may charge the actual postage amount, to be paid before mailing.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in the format requested. Grebner v. Schiebel, 2001 WI App 17, 240 Wis.2d 551.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in a time frame established by the requester. Reasonableness of the response time is determined by the volume of records requested, the ability to locate the records, review of records for possible redaction, and other work assignments. Journal Times v. City of Racine Bd. of Police & Fire Comm’rs, 2015 WI 56, 362 Wis.2d 577; WIREdata Inc. v. Village of Sussex, 2008 WI 69, 310 Wis.2d 397.
We are in the process of evaluating your request and will provide further information as it becomes available. 

Thank you,

Vanessa Jahns
 
Deputy City Clerk

title: Enterprise Data Inventory (EDI) (Bureau of Land Management)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Your Enterprise Data Inventory (EDI), as described in federal guidance https://resources.data.gov/assets/documents/CDOC_Data_Inventory_Report_Final.pdf?trk=public_post_comment-text, in a machine-readable database or spreadsheet format such as Excel, CSV, Access or SQL. 

I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Records retention schedule (Bureau of Prisons)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all materials, indices, directives, manuals, and other guiding documentation regarding records generated and retained, including but not limited to: 

• Record retention schedules
• Any other data structures used for the management of records: digital, paper, and otherwise

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form. If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address. If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. 

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Records retention schedule (Department of Energy)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all materials, indices, directives, manuals, and other guiding documentation regarding records generated and retained, including but not limited to: 

• Record retention schedules
• Any other data structures used for the management of records: digital, paper, and otherwise

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form. If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address. communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All guides, memos or briefings on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records. 

- All polices on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records. 

-  All employee training materials on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Reocords Request: Suspected Falsified Documents to the EPA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Reocords Request: Suspected Falsified Documents to the EPA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-A log of complaints, filed to the Environmental Protection Agency between January 1st, 2025 and the date of response to this request, concerning the suspected tampering, misrepresentation, or otherwise altering of documents, permits, certifications, or any other records required by environmental statutes and/or regulations.

I'm a journalist with the nonprofit newsroom Sentient. Any responsive documents will be used in reporting relating to public health, safety, and environmental concerns in the public interest.

In the case that the response to this is voluminous, I would appreciate being provided records in installments to expedite the process.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

title: Tyler Robinson Arrest 2 (Department of Justice, United States Marshals)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and a copy of body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by officers of the Utah Valley University Police Department related specifically to the arrest of Tyler Robinson on the evening of September 11, 2025.

Primary subject of request: Arrest of Tyler Robinson (suspect connected to the Charlie Kirk homicide investigation)

Relevant prior event context: Homicide of Charlie Kirk on September 10, 2025 (for situational context only)

Date of records requested: September 11, 2025

Approximate time frame: Beginning around 6:00 p.m. on Sept. 11, 2025, and continuing for several hours thereafter (evening hours)

Location: Within the jurisdiction of the Utah Valley University Police Department; expected in/around Orem, Utah (Utah County). If the arrest occurred at a different precise location within UVU PD jurisdiction, please include all responsive BWC from that location.

Type of incident: Arrest (law enforcement action)

Records requested:

All BWC footage capturing the detention, arrest, transport, and on-scene interactions with Tyler Robinson on Sept. 11, 2025, within the time window above.

Any BWC footage from responding/assisting UVU PD officers at that scene during the same window (including pre-arrest approach and post-arrest processing on scene).

Case number / officers: Unknown. If available, please include the case number and the names/badge numbers of officers whose cameras recorded the footage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Dohanyos
